channel.title: CVE Feed for F5 Networks, Inc. -- BIG-IP APM
channel.description: The latest CVEs for F5 Networks, Inc. -- BIG-IP APM

item.title: CVE-2017-0301|2024-08-05T13:03:56.586Z -- f5%20networks%2C%20inc. -- big-ip%20apm
item.description: In F5 BIG-IP APM software versions 11.5.0, 11.5.1, 11.5.2, 11.5.3, 11.5.4, 11.6.0, 11.6.1, 12.0.0, 12.1.0, 12.1.1 and 12.1.2 BIG-IP APM portal access requests do not return the intended resources in some cases. This may allow access to internal BIG-IP APM resources, however the application resources and backend servers are unaffected.

item.title: CVE-2017-6129|2024-08-05T15:18:49.850Z -- f5%20networks%2C%20inc. -- big-ip%20apm
item.description: In F5 BIG-IP APM software version 13.0.0 and 12.1.2, in some circumstances, APM tunneled VPN flows can cause a VPN/PPP connflow to be prematurely freed or cause TMM to stop responding with a "flow not in use" assertion. An attacker may be able to disrupt traffic or cause the BIG-IP system to fail over to another device in the device group.

item.title: CVE-2018-5548|2024-08-05T05:40:50.581Z -- f5%20networks%2C%20inc. -- big-ip%20apm
item.description: On BIG-IP APM 11.6.0-11.6.3, an insecure AES ECB mode is used for orig_uri parameter in an undisclosed /vdesk link of APM virtual server configured with an access profile, allowing a malicious user to build a redirect URI value using different blocks of cipher texts.

item.title: CVE-2017-6139|2024-08-05T15:18:49.677Z -- f5%20networks%2C%20inc. -- big-ip%20apm
item.description: In F5 BIG-IP APM software version 13.0.0 and 12.1.2, under rare conditions, the BIG-IP APM system appends log details when responding to client requests. Details in the log file can vary; customers running debug mode logging with BIG-IP APM are at highest risk.

item.title: CVE-2018-15310|2024-08-05T09:46:25.671Z -- f5%20networks%2C%20inc. -- big-ip%20apm
item.description: A vulnerability in BIG-IP APM portal access 11.5.1-11.5.7, 11.6.0-11.6.3, and 12.1.0-12.1.3 discloses the BIG-IP software version in rewritten pages.

item.title: CVE-2017-0302|2024-08-05T13:03:56.335Z -- f5%20networks%2C%20inc. -- big-ip%20apm
item.description: In F5 BIG-IP APM 12.0.0 through 12.1.2 and 13.0.0, an authenticated user with an established access session to the BIG-IP APM system may be able to cause a traffic disruption if the length of the requested URL is less than 16 characters.

item.title: CVE-2018-5549|2024-08-05T05:40:50.821Z -- f5%20networks%2C%20inc. -- big-ip%20apm
item.description: On BIG-IP APM 11.6.0-11.6.3.1, 12.1.0-12.1.3.3, 13.0.0, and 13.1.0-13.1.0.3, APMD may core when processing SAML Assertion or response containing certain elements.
